page.title: 05Ecology,Sth Benfleet/Thund.
page.content: Vegetation on the uplands of Thundersley is lighter than in South Benfleet.Scrub and heathland can be found amongst a variety of lighter trees than in South Benfleet,where the heavy soil supported elm trees for thousands of years,as well as oak,ash and thorn.Almost all of the elms succumbed to the Dutch Elm disease in the 1970's and most of their dead trunks have now been removed.Some young trees are emerging from suckers, but most begin to die on reaching a height of about 20 feet.The local council is making a good effort to plant new trees of a wide variety. Sadly,many of these young trees were vandalized,and it is now hoped that by enlisting school children with the planting of trees that these will be left to grow.
